location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from John Tod, Assistant Surgeon in Charge of the Bushire Residency to Henry Willock, HM Charge d'Affaires at the Court of Persia, Tehran

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a hole in the fabric of the folio. As a result, the address of the letter has been slightly obscured.

mods.abstract: The letter is explaining that a bill from Edward James Matthew for his travelling expenses from Bushire to Tehran has been returned; it is understood that the cost of his passage from Bushire was to be paid for by HM Mission to the Court of Persia, rather than by the Bombay Government.
